title: AT&T is Offering the Pixel 9a at a Low Monthly Price
description: There's also a limited-time offer on bundled Pixel Buds A offers. The post AT&T is Offering the Pixel 9a at a Low Monthly Price appeared first on Phandroid.
author: Mike Viray
excerpt: There's also a limited-time offer on bundled Pixel Buds A offers.
text: If you’re in the market for Google’s new Pixel 9a smartphone, then you might want to check out what AT&T is offering for the phone, which is now available (phew) via Google and select retailers after a slight delay following its original launch date. READ: Meet the Google Pixel 9a: Here’s What You need to Know! With that in mind, the Pixel 9a is available for order either via att.com, the myAT&T app, and in AT&T retail locations. AT&T is offering the Pixel 9a for just $2.99 per month with any unlimited plan with no trade-in required, as part of the AT&T Guarantee. Additionally, customers can enhance their service with AT&T Turbo for an extra $7 per month per line. For a limited time up until April 24th, online purchases of the Pixel 9a will also include a complimentary pair of Pixel Buds A-Series. Originally unveiled back in March, Google’s latest midranger comes with new upgrades over last year’s Pixel 8a including a larger and brighter 6.3-inch display, a more power-efficient Tensor G4 chipset, a larger 5,100 mAh battery, in addition to new camera hardware.
html:
If you’re in the market for Google’s new Pixel 9a smartphone, then you might want to check out what AT&T is offering for the phone, which is now available (phew) via Google and select retailers after a slight delay following its original launch date.

READ: Meet the Google Pixel 9a: Here’s What You need to Know!

With that in mind, the Pixel 9a is available for order either via att.com, the myAT&T app, and in AT&T retail locations. AT&T is offering the Pixel 9a for just $2.99 per month with any unlimited plan with no trade-in required, as part of the AT&T Guarantee. Additionally, customers can enhance their service with AT&T Turbo for an extra $7 per month per line. For a limited time up until April 24th, online purchases of the Pixel 9a will also include a complimentary pair of Pixel Buds A-Series.

Originally unveiled back in March, Google’s latest midranger comes with new upgrades over last year’s Pixel 8a including a larger and brighter 6.3-inch display, a more power-efficient Tensor G4 chipset, a larger 5,100 mAh battery, in addition to new camera hardware.
